CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Azure Security Benchmark
PolicyDescription: The Azure Security Benchmark initiative represents the policies and controls implementing security recommendations defined in Azure Security Benchmark v2, see https://aka.ms/azsecbm. This also serves as the Azure Security Center default policy initiative. You can directly assign this initiative, or manage its policies and compliance results within Azure Security Center.

PolicyAssignmentParameters: pricingTierAppServices=Standard, pricingTierArm=Standard, pricingTierContainerRegistry=Standard, pricingTierDns=Standard, pricingTierKeyVaults=Standard, pricingTierKubernetesService=Standard, pricingTierSqlServers=Standard, pricingTierStorageAccounts=Standard, pricingTierVms=Standard
CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Deploy Azure Defender settings in Azure Security Center.
PolicyDescription: Deploys  the Azure Defender settings in Azure Security Center for  the specific services.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Deploy Diagnostic Settings for Activity Log to Log Analytics workspace
PolicyDescription: Deploys the diagnostic settings for Activity Log to stream to a Log Analytics workspace when any Activity Log which is missing this diagnostic settings is created or updated. The policy wil  set the diagnostic with category enabled.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Configure Log Analytics agent on Azure Arc enabled Linux servers
PolicyDescription: Enable VM insights on servers and machines connected to Azure through Arc enabled servers by installing the Log Analytics agent virtual machine extension. VM insights uses the Log Analytics agent to collect the guest OS performance data, and provides insights into their performance. See more - https://aka.ms/vminsightsdocs.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Deploy Diagnostic Settings to Azure Services
PolicyDescription: This policy set deploys the configurations of application Azure resources to forward diagnostic logs and metrics to an Azure Log Analytics workspace. See the list of policies of the services that are included

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149

PolicyNameClear: Enable Azure Monitor for VMs
PolicyDescription: Enable Azure Monitor for the virtual machines (VMs) in the specified scope (management group, subscription or resource group). Takes Log Analytics workspace as parameter.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Enable Azure Monitor for Virtual Machine Scale Sets
PolicyDescription: Enable Azure Monitor for the Virtual Machine Scale Sets in the specified scope (Management group, Subscription or resource group). Takes Log Analytics workspace as parameter. Note: if your scale set upgradePolicy is set to Manual, you need to apply the extension to the all VMs in the set by calling upgrade on them. In CLI this would be az vmss update-instances.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Network interfaces should disable IP forwarding
PolicyDescription: This policy denies the network interfaces which enabled IP forwarding. The setting of IP forwarding disables Azure's check of the source and destination for a network interface. This should be reviewed by the network security team.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Kubernetes clusters should not allow container privilege escalation
PolicyDescription: Do not allow containers to run with privilege escalation to root in a Kubernetes cluster. This recommendation is part of CIS 5.2.5 which is intended to improve the security of your Kubernetes environments. This policy is generally available for Kubernetes Service (AKS), and preview for AKS Engine and Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes. For more information, see https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Kubernetes cluster should not allow privileged containers
PolicyDescription: Do not allow privileged containers creation in a Kubernetes cluster. This recommendation is part of CIS 5.2.1 which is intended to improve the security of your Kubernetes environments. This policy is generally available for Kubernetes Service (AKS), and preview for AKS Engine and Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes. For more information, see https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: RDP access from the Internet should be blocked
PolicyDescription: This policy denies any network security rule that allows RDP access from Internet

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
UpdatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Secure transfer to storage accounts should be enabled
PolicyDescription: Audit requirement of Secure transfer in your storage account. Secure transfer is an option that forces your storage account to accept requests only from secure connections (HTTPS). Use of HTTPS ensures authentication between the server and the service and protects data in transit from network layer attacks such as man-in-the-middle, eavesdropping, and session-hijacking

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Subnets should have a Network Security Group
PolicyDescription: This policy denies the creation of a subsnet with out an Network Security Group. NSG help to protect traffic across subnet-level.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Deploy Azure Policy Add-on to Azure Kubernetes Service clusters
PolicyDescription: Use Azure Policy Add-on to manage and report on the compliance state of your Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) clusters. For more information, see https://aka.ms/akspolicydoc.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Auditing on SQL server should be enabled
PolicyDescription: Auditing on your SQL Server should be enabled to track database activities across all databases on the server and save them in an audit log.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Configure backup on virtual machines without a given tag to a new recovery services vault with a default policy
PolicyDescription: Enforce backup for all virtual machines by deploying a recovery services vault in the same location and resource group as the virtual machine. Doing this is useful when different application teams in your organization are allocated separate resource groups and need to manage their own backups and restores. You can optionally exclude virtual machines containing a specified tag to control the scope of assignment. See https://aka.ms/AzureVMAppCentricBackupExcludeTag.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Kubernetes clusters should be accessible only over HTTPS
PolicyDescription: Use of HTTPS ensures authentication and protects data in transit from network layer eavesdropping attacks. This capability is currently generally available for Kubernetes Service (AKS), and in preview for AKS Engine and Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes. For more info, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Deploy SQL DB transparent data encryption
PolicyDescription: Enables transparent data encryption on SQL databases

PolicyAssignmentDescription: This policy assignment was automatically created by Azure Security Center
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP App EXT, ObjectDisplayName: Windows Azure Security Resource Provider, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: 9ac4e379-ffb1-4e2c-ac89-3752d019abfd (rp)
PolicyNameClear: Configure Azure Defender to be enabled on SQL Servers and SQL Managed Instances
PolicyDescription: Enable Azure Defender on your SQL Servers and SQL Managed Instances to detect anomalous activities indicating unusual and potentially harmful attempts to access or exploit databases.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Network interfaces should disable IP forwarding
PolicyDescription: This policy denies the network interfaces which enabled IP forwarding. The setting of IP forwarding disables Azure's check of the source and destination for a network interface. This should be reviewed by the network security team.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Kubernetes clusters should not allow container privilege escalation
PolicyDescription: Do not allow containers to run with privilege escalation to root in a Kubernetes cluster. This recommendation is part of CIS 5.2.5 which is intended to improve the security of your Kubernetes environments. This policy is generally available for Kubernetes Service (AKS), and preview for AKS Engine and Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes. For more information, see https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Kubernetes cluster should not allow privileged containers
PolicyDescription: Do not allow privileged containers creation in a Kubernetes cluster. This recommendation is part of CIS 5.2.1 which is intended to improve the security of your Kubernetes environments. This policy is generally available for Kubernetes Service (AKS), and preview for AKS Engine and Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes. For more information, see https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: RDP access from the Internet should be blocked
PolicyDescription: This policy denies any network security rule that allows RDP access from Internet

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
UpdatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Secure transfer to storage accounts should be enabled
PolicyDescription: Audit requirement of Secure transfer in your storage account. Secure transfer is an option that forces your storage account to accept requests only from secure connections (HTTPS). Use of HTTPS ensures authentication between the server and the service and protects data in transit from network layer attacks such as man-in-the-middle, eavesdropping, and session-hijacking

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Subnets should have a Network Security Group
PolicyDescription: This policy denies the creation of a subsnet with out an Network Security Group. NSG help to protect traffic across subnet-level.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Deploy Azure Policy Add-on to Azure Kubernetes Service clusters
PolicyDescription: Use Azure Policy Add-on to manage and report on the compliance state of your Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) clusters. For more information, see https://aka.ms/akspolicydoc.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Auditing on SQL server should be enabled
PolicyDescription: Auditing on your SQL Server should be enabled to track database activities across all databases on the server and save them in an audit log.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Configure backup on virtual machines without a given tag to a new recovery services vault with a default policy
PolicyDescription: Enforce backup for all virtual machines by deploying a recovery services vault in the same location and resource group as the virtual machine. Doing this is useful when different application teams in your organization are allocated separate resource groups and need to manage their own backups and restores. You can optionally exclude virtual machines containing a specified tag to control the scope of assignment. See https://aka.ms/AzureVMAppCentricBackupExcludeTag.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Kubernetes clusters should be accessible only over HTTPS
PolicyDescription: Use of HTTPS ensures authentication and protects data in transit from network layer eavesdropping attacks. This capability is currently generally available for Kubernetes Service (AKS), and in preview for AKS Engine and Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes. For more info, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Deploy SQL DB transparent data encryption
PolicyDescription: Enables transparent data encryption on SQL databases

PolicyNameClear: Kubernetes cluster should not allow privileged containers
PolicyDescription: Do not allow privileged containers creation in a Kubernetes cluster. This recommendation is part of CIS 5.2.1 which is intended to improve the security of your Kubernetes environments. This policy is generally available for Kubernetes Service (AKS), and preview for AKS Engine and Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes. For more information, see https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: RDP access from the Internet should be blocked
PolicyDescription: This policy denies any network security rule that allows RDP access from Internet

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
UpdatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Secure transfer to storage accounts should be enabled
PolicyDescription: Audit requirement of Secure transfer in your storage account. Secure transfer is an option that forces your storage account to accept requests only from secure connections (HTTPS). Use of HTTPS ensures authentication between the server and the service and protects data in transit from network layer attacks such as man-in-the-middle, eavesdropping, and session-hijacking

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Subnets should have a Network Security Group
PolicyDescription: This policy denies the creation of a subsnet with out an Network Security Group. NSG help to protect traffic across subnet-level.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Deploy Azure Policy Add-on to Azure Kubernetes Service clusters
PolicyDescription: Use Azure Policy Add-on to manage and report on the compliance state of your Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) clusters. For more information, see https://aka.ms/akspolicydoc.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Auditing on SQL server should be enabled
PolicyDescription: Auditing on your SQL Server should be enabled to track database activities across all databases on the server and save them in an audit log.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Configure backup on virtual machines without a given tag to a new recovery services vault with a default policy
PolicyDescription: Enforce backup for all virtual machines by deploying a recovery services vault in the same location and resource group as the virtual machine. Doing this is useful when different application teams in your organization are allocated separate resource groups and need to manage their own backups and restores. You can optionally exclude virtual machines containing a specified tag to control the scope of assignment. See https://aka.ms/AzureVMAppCentricBackupExcludeTag.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Kubernetes clusters should be accessible only over HTTPS
PolicyDescription: Use of HTTPS ensures authentication and protects data in transit from network layer eavesdropping attacks. This capability is currently generally available for Kubernetes Service (AKS), and in preview for AKS Engine and Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes. For more info, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Deploy SQL DB transparent data encryption
PolicyDescription: Enables transparent data encryption on SQL databases

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Azure Security Benchmark
PolicyDescription: The Azure Security Benchmark initiative represents the policies and controls implementing security recommendations defined in Azure Security Benchmark v2, see https://aka.ms/azsecbm. This also serves as the Azure Security Center default policy initiative. You can directly assign this initiative, or manage its policies and compliance results within Azure Security Center.

PolicyAssignmentParameters: pricingTierAppServices=Standard, pricingTierArm=Standard, pricingTierContainerRegistry=Standard, pricingTierDns=Standard, pricingTierKeyVaults=Standard, pricingTierKubernetesService=Standard, pricingTierSqlServers=Standard, pricingTierStorageAccounts=Standard, pricingTierVms=Standard
CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Deploy Azure Defender settings in Azure Security Center.
PolicyDescription: Deploys  the Azure Defender settings in Azure Security Center for  the specific services.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Deploy Diagnostic Settings for Activity Log to Log Analytics workspace
PolicyDescription: Deploys the diagnostic settings for Activity Log to stream to a Log Analytics workspace when any Activity Log which is missing this diagnostic settings is created or updated. The policy wil  set the diagnostic with category enabled.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Configure Log Analytics agent on Azure Arc enabled Linux servers
PolicyDescription: Enable VM insights on servers and machines connected to Azure through Arc enabled servers by installing the Log Analytics agent virtual machine extension. VM insights uses the Log Analytics agent to collect the guest OS performance data, and provides insights into their performance. See more - https://aka.ms/vminsightsdocs.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Deploy Diagnostic Settings to Azure Services
PolicyDescription: This policy set deploys the configurations of application Azure resources to forward diagnostic logs and metrics to an Azure Log Analytics workspace. See the list of policies of the services that are included

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
UpdatedBy: ObjectType: SP App INT , ObjectDisplayName: AzOps, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: c295384a-33d9-475e-abaf-d2fb0274299a
PolicyNameClear: Enable Azure Monitor for VMs
PolicyDescription: Enable Azure Monitor for the virtual machines (VMs) in the specified scope (management group, subscription or resource group). Takes Log Analytics workspace as parameter.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Enable Azure Monitor for Virtual Machine Scale Sets
PolicyDescription: Enable Azure Monitor for the Virtual Machine Scale Sets in the specified scope (Management group, Subscription or resource group). Takes Log Analytics workspace as parameter. Note: if your scale set upgradePolicy is set to Manual, you need to apply the extension to the all VMs in the set by calling upgrade on them. In CLI this would be az vmss update-instances.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: ESDeploymentAccount, ObjectSignInName: ESDeploymentAccount@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: b790b1e1-6f46-488b-8c5a-708b0db9a149
PolicyNameClear: Configure Log Analytics agent on Azure Arc enabled Windows servers
PolicyDescription: Enable VM insights on servers and machines connected to Azure through Arc enabled servers by installing the Log Analytics agent virtual machine extension. VM insights uses the Log Analytics agent to collect the guest OS performance data, and provides insights into their performance. See more - https://aka.ms/vminsightsdocs.

CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP App INT , ObjectDisplayName: AzOps, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: c295384a-33d9-475e-abaf-d2fb0274299a
PolicyNameClear: [Deprecated]: Function App should only be accessible over HTTPS
PolicyDescription: Use of HTTPS ensures server/service authentication and protects data in transit from network layer eavesdropping attacks.

PolicyAssignmentDisplayName: Audit virtual machines without disaster recovery configured
CreatedBy: ObjectType: User Member, ObjectDisplayName: Joe Dalton, ObjectSignInName: joe.dalton@AzGovViz.onmicrosoft.com, ObjectId: acf4c68f-7b15-4d70-935b-26116fc2426a
PolicyNameClear: Audit virtual machines without disaster recovery configured
PolicyDescription: Audit virtual machines which do not have disaster recovery configured. To learn more about disaster recovery, visit https://aka.ms/asr-doc.

PolicyAssignmentDescription: This policy assignment was automatically created by Azure Security Center
CreatedBy: ObjectType: SP App EXT, ObjectDisplayName: Windows Azure Security Resource Provider, ObjectSignInName: n/a, ObjectId: 9ac4e379-ffb1-4e2c-ac89-3752d019abfd (rp)
PolicyNameClear: Configure Azure Defender to be enabled on SQL Servers and SQL Managed Instances
PolicyDescription: Enable Azure Defender on your SQL Servers and SQL Managed Instances to detect anomalous activities indicating unusual and potentially harmful attempts to access or exploit databases.
